definition: abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]

sentences.english: Without true love we just exist, Alfie.
sentences.chinese: 沒有真愛，我們只是白活，阿飛。

sentences.english: Click ALFY to help him make a snowman.
sentences.chinese: 按一下阿飛幫助他堆一個雪人。

sentences.english: The rioters in Egypt were freedom fighters; the rioters in London were punks and thugs.
sentences.chinese: 埃及的暴動者是自由戰士，倫敦的卻是阿飛和惡棍。

sentences.english: I thought it was those punks, but no one was there.
sentences.chinese: 我以爲是那些小阿飛，但是門口並沒有人。

sentences.english: Help ALFY build a fort by first clicking on the chair.
sentences.chinese: 幫助阿飛建造一座堡壘，先按一下椅子。

sentences.english: Click on ALFY's house to return home.
sentences.chinese: 按一下阿飛的房子回家。

sentences.english: Click on Alfy's new friends to end the school day.
sentences.chinese: 按一下阿飛的新朋友結束學校的日子。

sentences.english: The car stops and the Punks get out.
sentences.chinese: 車子停下，小阿飛們走下車。

sentences.english: In its fang and small star's call, teddy boy woke up, a reunion.
sentences.chinese: 在其芳和小星的呼喚中，阿飛醒了，一家團圓。

sentences.english: Click on the sheet that is on ALFY's bed.
sentences.chinese: 按一下阿飛牀上的牀單。

sentences.english: Click on ALFY to see him skateboard for you.
sentences.chinese: 按一下阿飛來看他爲你滑滑板。

sentences.english: Click on the blue paint to help ALFY and his friends finger paint.
sentences.chinese: 按一下藍色的顏料幫助阿飛和他的朋友用手指畫。

sentences.english: Click on ALFY to give him a good idea.
sentences.chinese: 按一下阿飛給他一個好主意。

sentences.english: Click on the sled to send ALFY and his friend down the hill for a ride.
sentences.chinese: 按一下雪橇送阿飛和他的朋友從山上下來滑一圈。

sentences.english: Now click on ALFY's hat and mittens.
sentences.chinese: 現在按一下阿飛的帽子和手套。

definition: The New Yorker, US magazine/resident of New York
Rowling (name)/Joanne Kathleen Rowling (1965-), author of the Harry Potter series of novels
(haven't done sth) for a long time/a long time since we last met
Moore or Moor (name)/see also 摩爾人|摩尔人[Mo2 er3 ren2]

dramatic form consisting of historical narration/history as jocular narrative/to stretch history for a joking story/amusing story with strained interpretations of history/to make an unreasonable comparison in jest
